moves.1. e4 c5 2. b4: Sicilian wing gambit that Stalhandske showed me. The first time I use it.
moves.4. e5: i found this aggressive and strange move in the Database. As I'm experimenting, I'll try it.
moves.5... Nxb4: Black has little reason not to take.
moves.6. c3: to fire the black knight and devellop
moves.9... Bg4: Pinning the knight, knowing that the brave Lancelot won't sacrify his true love and queen.
moves.11. Qxf3: Now that there is no more black LSB, I estimatte that it's not a bad place for the queen.
moves.12. Bc4: the archer counterattacks with a mating menace.
moves.13. O-O: So that King Arthur can hide in his castle.
moves.13... exd4: Black wins another pawn but his king his naked and white has plenty of attacking possibilities (it seems to be the advantage of this gambit).
moves.14. Re1+: "Send the war machines against the ennemy king"
moves.15. Bxf7: Black is in trouble and his d pawn is almost pinned.
moves.16. Be6: ... So that white attacks her black majesty
moves.17... Qc5 18. cxd4: Time to liquidate black's central heroïcal soldier.
moves.18... Qb6: If 18. ... Qxd4 19. Rd1 If 18. ... Nxd4 19. Qxb7 with mating menace.
moves.20... Kf8: Forced move but I do not see how to carry on.
moves.22. Nc3: Finally, black manages to develop. Most of his troops are regrouped in the corner but I do not see ho to carry on attacking, so that I decide to call for reserves. Perceval saddle his warhorse and rides to the battle.
moves.23. Qe4: I had a lot of difficulties to find this move. I tried many other lines but they were all bad for white.
moves.23... Bxd6:
"My king, we lost our archering company but our position still gives us an advantage"
" Carry on, brave soldiers but be carefull now."
moves.24. Rad1: Protecting the d pawn so that black cannot settle on the center.
moves.24... Ne7: Probably to prevent d5 but it doesn't seem a great move.
moves.25. Qf3: Menacing check "à découverte" with mate to follow.
moves.27. Qf7+: The black king will have to flee near the right edge where he'll be trapped.
moves.29... Ng6: Another possibility was 29. ... Kg5 30. Qg7+ with mating sequence to follow (white has to bring his knight on e4)
moves.31. g4+: From now on, all of black's moves are forced.
moves.31... Kh4 32. Rh6+: The black king goes back on g5
